availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew J. Martin (Caldwell County, KY, farmer and pvt 24th Ky Inf Reg.)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Tiglman Martin. Married to Fare Ellendar E. Dunning Martin in Trigg County, Kentucky, in April 1861. Father of William J. Martin and V. L. Martin. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860. Served in the 24th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A) as private from December 31, 1861, to May 10, 1862.
